comments.body: If this gets called once per type on startup then it doesn't matter, but if not then in a followup it might be reasonable to replace this with a generated type switch rather than using reflection. It probably won't get called often enough to matter. I just mention this because we've had to do similar things in the api encode/decode paths.

this is only called once per type per swagger generation that is O(N) at startup (N is number of endpoints/~VersionKinds). I don't think this would be a (any) performance issue. I hope that sometime in future I can auto-generate routes/paths or at least improve it a little. In that change this would be among the firsts to go.
Godoc on all public types and methods, and godoc on all fields of public types following standard Godoc rules ( must start with the field name and form a complete sentence).
same. Is warning and continuing better than returning error?
Needs godoc describing the general pattern you're applying here
